name: Warehouse
description: Outgoing integration to warehouses for Users, Accounts and Events

private_settings.name: db_hostname
private_settings.title: Database Hostname
private_settings.description: The hostname of the postgres database to connect to

private_settings.name: db_port
private_settings.title: Database Port
private_settings.description: The port that you want to connect to

private_settings.name: db_name
private_settings.title: Database Name
private_settings.description: The name of the database that you want to connect to

private_settings.name: user_outgoing_sync_title
private_settings.title: Outgoing User Synchronization Options (Hull to Warehouse)

private_settings.name: synchronized_user_segments
private_settings.title: User Filter
private_settings.description: Send *Users* to your warehouse when belonging to one of these segments

private_settings.name: send_all_user_attributes
private_settings.title: Sending all user attributes by default

private_settings.name: send_all_account_attributes
private_settings.title: Sending all account attributes by default

private_settings.name: account_outgoing_synch_title
private_settings.title: Outgoing Account Synchronization Options (Hull to Warehouse)

private_settings.name: synchronized_account_segments
private_settings.title: Account Filter
private_settings.description: Send *Accounts* to your warehouse when belonging to one of these segments

private_settings.name: outgoing_table_naming_title
private_settings.title: Tables to Sync to in Postgres

private_settings.name: db_user_table_name
private_settings.title: User Table Name
private_settings.description: The User table will contain all user attributes in columns. You may join to the account table using the "accountId" field.  As new attributes are created in Hull, this connector adds columns to this table

private_settings.name: db_events_table_name
private_settings.title: Events Table Name
private_settings.description: The Event table is a static schema which can be joined to the user table using the "userId" column.  The properties and context columns are JSON columns which contain attributes associated with the event

private_settings.name: db_account_table_name
private_settings.title: Account Table Name
private_settings.description: The Account table will contain all account attributes in columns. As new attributes are created in Hull, this connector adds columns to this table

private_settings.name: flow_control_user_update_success_size
private_settings.title: Flow control setting for success on user update

private_settings.name: ascii_encoded_database
private_settings.title: Truncate fields based on ascii lengths
private_settings.description: String fields are encoded with varchar(255) which means if you have a value greater than 255 characters, we truncate the field.  If the database is encoded in SQL_ASCII, the truncation must be calculated based on the number of bytes of the value.  Enable this if your database is encoded in SQL_ASCII so that the truncation calculation is correct

private_settings.name: use_native_json_field_type
private_settings.title: When creating the table schema, use the native postgres json field type instead of a varchar(255)
private_settings.description: We store nested json values as strings by default.  Enable this option to use postgres's native json column type.  If your tables already exist, you'll have to either drop the table or specify a new table for it to be rebuilt properly

settings_sections.title: Database Connection Information
settings_sections.description: Please fill out the following database connection information.  Because this connector is hosted in Heroku, we are unable to provide a static ip address which the connection will be coming from

settings_sections.title: Database Login Information
settings_sections.description: You will need a user and password which can create tables (if the tables do not exist) and functions (used to upsert data).  Additionally the user will need permission to alter tables (to add columns when new attributes appear).

settings_sections.title: Tables to populate
settings_sections.description: Once configured, this connector will automatically create the following 3 tables to store your User/Account/Event data

settings_sections.title: User/Account Filter Setup
settings_sections.description: There are a variety of ways to configure subsets of data to be sent to your warehouse.  By defining a user/account segments, then specifying them in this section, you can control which users(and their events) and accounts are sent to your warehouse.  If you want all data sent, there is an option to send "All" users and/or accounts in each dropdown
